identification.cap: 1.57-9.84 inches diameter, convex or bell-shaped to flatter with broad low umbo, pale grey-brown to hazel-brown mid-brown darker center, sticky slimy moist silky radial wrinkles dry.
identification.flesh: White to off-white, thin soft watery cap fibrous tough stem, neutral to slightly fruity odor mild flavor.
identification.gills: Adnate with slight decurrent tooth or almost free, white to pale cream darkening edges, distant with numerous lamellulae, edges wavy serrated spotted brown older.
identification.stem: 2.36-7.87 inches (up to 9.84) long, 0.2-0.59 inches diameter, slender cylindrical twisted, deeply rooted elongated base taproot plunging into buried wood, white apex darkening to brown base, finely floccose longitudinally fibrillar, no ring.
identification.microscopic: Spores 12-19 × 8-14 µm broadly ellipsoidal to lemon-shaped smooth germ pore inamyloid; basidia 45-55 × 10-15 µm clavate 4-spored clamp connections; cheilocystidia 60-110 × 12-35 µm broadly clavate ventricose; pleurocystidia 60-120 × 22-35 µm swollen blunt-ended.

habitat: Saprobic on decaying wood rotting stumps buried hardwood, broadleaf trees beech occasionally conifers, early summer to late autumn, Britain Ireland mainland Europe North America.
